alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Central; Baldwin Inland; Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 1:20PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Baldwin, southwestern Escambia and northwestern Escambia Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 120 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northeast of Stapleton, or 8 miles southeast of Bay Minette, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bay Minette, Atmore, Stapleton, I65 And CR 1 and Poarch Creek Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
